quoteFirst: I went out with an observer on a howitzer shoot, an officer in this case. We went over to the lines, arriving there about
quoteLast: and “rang up” the battery. All being well, we ploughed over the lines to have a look at the target in Hunland. The battery then fired, and the observer watched for the burst and wirelessed back the correction.
title: War Flying

quoteFirst: Ten o'clock came, when a larger portion of the audience was again perturbed by railway warnings. Disraeli was still speaking. Eleven o'clock came; the audience had further decreased then, but Disraeli was still declaiming hoarse sentences. It was a
quoteLast: before his peroration came to an end; and many, who wished to have their guinea's worth of Parliamentary oratory, had to sleep in Manchester that night Everybody knew the speaker would have ceased two hours earlier if he could. His host in the chair was much disquieted.

quoteFirst: We went into the yard, under the pillars of the town hall, across the silent street, through a narrow passage, and down to the sea. Old Rangsley reeled ahead of us swiftly, muttering, “Three men to be set aboard the _Thames_...
quoteLast: . Three men to be set aboard...” and in a few minutes we stood upon the shingle beside the idle sea, that was nearly at the full.
